content.description: This route follows the middle of the prominent and continuous slab that can be seen from the overlook. At this time, it may be easiest to rappel in due to the difficult terrain at the base of the cliff. Follow the bolts up the continuous slab to an awesome layback feature where the angle steepens. A few more techy moves and a mantle guard the anchors. At this time the key holds are clean, but the route as a whole is very dirty, be prepared to do a bit of scrubbing. If it were a bit cleaner, the route would gain a star or two!
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor w/rings
content.location: Once at the overlook area, look to the north and you can see the slab in its entirety. You should be able to see a line of bolts and anchors towards the middle of the face.

content.description: An area with an impressive view. Currently the only wall with established route(s) at Buzzard Rocks.
